user.title: Connect to Homey
user.description:
Enter your Homey IP address and API key to connect.

‚ö†Ô∏è **For Real-Time Updates**: To enable Socket.IO instant updates (< 1 second), create a new API key in Homey Settings ‚Üí API Keys with the **System ‚Üí View System** (`homey.system.readonly`) permission enabled. Without this, the integration will use polling (5-10 seconds).

reauth_confirm.title: Reauthenticate Homey
reauth_confirm.description: Your Homey API key is no longer valid. Create a new API key in Homey Settings ‚Üí API Keys with the required permissions and enter it below.

device_management.title: Manage Devices
device_management.description:
Select which devices to include in Home Assistant. Currently selected devices are pre-checked. You can add or remove devices as needed. Changes will be applied after saving.

üí° Tip: Use your browser's search (Ctrl+F / Cmd+F) to quickly find devices by name, room, or type.

error.cannot_connect:
Unable to connect to Homey. Please check:
- The IP address is correct
- Homey is powered on and accessible on your network
- The API key is valid
- Homey API is enabled
error.invalid_auth: Invalid API key. Please check your API key in Homey Settings ‚Üí API Keys.
error.cannot_fetch_devices: Unable to fetch devices from Homey. The connection was successful but device list could not be retrieved. Proceeding with all devices.
error.unknown: An unexpected error occurred. Check the logs for details.

abort.already_configured: This Homey hub is already configured.

init.title: Homey Options
init.description: Choose what you want to update.

settings.title: Connection & Polling
settings.description:
Update Homey connection settings and fallback polling. Leave API key blank to keep the current one. Polling is only used when Socket.IO is not working. For Socket.IO real-time updates, create a new API key with **System ‚Üí View System** (`homey.system.readonly`).

Editable text inputs: When enabled, settable string capabilities without predefined options will appear as editable text fields. This disables the read-only sensors below to avoid duplicates.

Read-only strings (default on): When enabled, string capabilities are shown as read-only sensors (useful for status/notification fields). This is ignored if editable text inputs are enabled.

data.token: API Key (leave blank to keep current)
data.expose_settable_text: Expose string capabilities as editable text inputs (disables read-only)
data.expose_readonly_strings: Expose string capabilities as read-only sensors (default, off when editable is enabled)
data.use_capability_titles: Use Homey capability titles for entity names
